The Hughes Springs ISD Athletic Department will resume its summer conditioning program on Monday, July 13, 2020.

The program will run July 13 - July 17 and July 27 - July 31.

There will be no workouts the week of July 20- 24, as our coaches will be in training that week.

HIgh School Boys/Girls start at 8:00 am each day.

Jr. High Boys/Girls start at 10:00 am each day.

Every participant will be required to have a mask and must wear it when not actively participating in conditioning.

There will be no evening workouts available.

Use of the weight room is not allowed. All workouts will be at a practice field, gym, multipurpose building or outside.

Please bring your own water and towel.

Boys please report to the front of the Field House.

Girls please report to the HSHS Gym.

Cross Country please report to the front of the HSHS Gym.

If you have questions, contact Coach Edwards at 639-3862 or edwardsc@hsisd.net.

Governor Issues Executive Order that Includes Statewide Closure of Texas Schools

Gov. Greg Abbott announced today that he has issued an executive order that aligns with the standards set by the president and the Centers for Disease Control. The order, which is effective at midnight Friday, March 20, through midnight Friday, April 3 (and subject to extension) requires:

‚Ä¢ all Texas schools to temporarily close, but offer online or other learning options to students
‚Ä¢ all Texans to avoid gatherings of 10 or more people
‚Ä¢ all bars, restaurants, food courts, and gyms to close

The governor said that this is not a shelter-in-place order. It does not prohibit people from leaving their homes or from traveling domestically. All critical infrastructure will remain open; government entities will still provide essential services.

In light of this, HSISD will not open until Monday, April 6, 2020!

Just a reminder! While our attendance is in the normal range, we have had several confirmed cases of the flu this week! Wouldn't hurt to wash backpacks, lunch boxes & coats this weekend!

TIPS TO HELP PREVENT THE SPREAD OF FLU~

‚Ä¢Washing your hands often.
‚Ä¢Covering your coughs and sneezes.
‚Ä¢Staying home from school or work if you are feeling ill.
‚Ä¢Cleaning common surfaces like doorknobs, handles, and keyboards.

If your child has had a fever within the past 24 hours, please do NOT send them to school!

They need to be fever free for at least 24 hours without the use of fever reducing medications (Tylenol/Motrin/etc)!

We are doing our part disinfecting the school, please do your part & do not send a sick child to school!

HSISD has not had a major outbreak yet, but it is in our area and two other Cass County schools have already had to close due to the flu!
